intro: Platycodon mariesii f. striatus, commonly known as the striped bellflower, is a striking perennial plant native to Korea. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple, with distinctive white or light-colored stripes running along the petals. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and ease of cultivation make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and cultivated landscapes.
